definition: (of taste) hot or pungent/hard/laborious/suffering/eighth in order/eighth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/letter "H" or Roman "VIII" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 285°/octa
"silk" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 120), occurring in 红, 绿, 累 etc/also pr. [mi4]

(of taste) hot or pungent/hard/laborious/suffering/eighth in order/eighth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/letter "H" or Roman "VIII" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 285°/octa
plait/braid/pigtail/a mistake or shortcoming that may be exploited by an opponent/handle/CL:根[gen1],條|条[tiao2]
pigtail/(fig.) a shortcoming or evidence of wrongdoing that can be seized upon by others
to grab sb by the pigtail/to seize on weak points/to exploit the opponent's shortcomings
to grab sb by the queue (i.e. hair)/to seize on weak points/to exploit the opponent's shortcomings
to shave the head but keep the queue
erhua variant of 小辮|小辫[xiao3 bian4]
(bird species of China) eared pitta (Hydrornis phayrei)

sentences.english: I combed my hair with my hair brush and made it into a pony.
sentences.chinese: 我用我的梳子梳头并把头发弄成小马辫。

sentences.english: It is spatially related to Jurassic Zhiluo Formation with braided palaeochannel systems.
sentences.chinese: 空间上，它与侏罗纪直罗组辫状古河道体系有关。

sentences.english: Then, the sternal wound was reconstructed with pectoralis major muscle flaps.
sentences.chinese: 然后，以胸大肌辫重建胸骨伤口。

sentences.english: It's pneumatic system act the thread- snipping and lube spray.
sentences.chinese: 其供气系统实现线辫剪断和油雾润滑的喷射。

sentences.english: Lizy braids two long and thin pigtails, and looks very lovely.
sentences.chinese: 丽兹扎着两只细溜溜的长辫，很可爱。

sentences.english: Sallow and emaciated, firm flower plait, but is very confused, the facial expression be diffused.
sentences.chinese: 面黄肌瘦，扎着花辫，却甚是零乱，表情苍茫。

sentences.english: Do not adorn yourselves outwardly by braiding your hair, by wearing gold ornaments,or fine clothing.
sentences.chinese: 你们不要以外面的辫头发，戴金饰，穿美衣，为妆饰。

sentences.english: Then I'm just going to stretch out the braid to make it look fuller and bigger.
sentences.chinese: 然后我要伸展开发辫，使它看起来更饱满更大。

sentences.english: Amy’s curly hair was straightened and put into a pony.
sentences.chinese: 艾米的卷发很直，他也把它扎成小马辫。

sentences.english: The latest side braids are another amazing christmas hair trend.
sentences.chinese: 最新的侧边麻花辫又是圣诞节的一大流行发式。

sentences.english: Resection and reconstruction with flaps proved a good method to treat sternal fistulae.
sentences.chinese: 证实切除术和胸大肌辫重建是治疗胸骨廔管的良策。

sentences.english: The design was later changed to traditional robes and long hair in a pony -tail .
sentences.chinese: 造型后来就改成了传统的长袍和长发后面配小马辫。

sentences.english: It is not surprising to me at all that men still love women with long hair.
sentences.chinese: 因此，男人用大辫爱女人，就不足为奇了。

definition: Mawei district of Fuzhou city 福州市[Fu2 zhou1 shi4], Fujian
ponytail (hairstyle)/horse's tail/slender fibers like horse's tail (applies to various plants)
plait/braid/pigtail/a mistake or shortcoming that may be exploited by an opponent/handle/CL:根[gen1],條|条[tiao2]
erhua variant of 小辮|小辫[xiao3 bian4]
pigtail/(fig.) a shortcoming or evidence of wrongdoing that can be seized upon by others
hair worn in a bun or coil
